intro: Comolia denudata, commonly known as the naked comolia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale blue or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native range.
